snippet: Lawyers for a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden accused of supporting terrorists have asked a judge to grant them access to Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, a key planner of the Sept. 11 terror attacks.
abstract: Lawyers in Manhattan for Sulaiman Abu Ghaith, son-in-law of Osama bin Laden accused of supporting terrorists, have asked federal judge to grant them access to Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, key planner of Sept 11 terror attacks, because his testimony could clear their client; say Mohammed had agreed through his lawyer to speak with them, but that the Defense Department has yet to grant them the necessary approvals.
lead_paragraph: Lawyers for a son-in-law of Osama bin Laden accused of supporting terrorists have asked a judge to grant them access to Khalid Shaikh Mohammed, a key planner of the Sept. 11 terror attacks.

headline.main: Lawyers in Terrorism Case Seek Access to 9/11 Suspect
headline.print_headline: Lawyers in Terrorism Case Seek Access to 9/11 Suspect
